head.title: Which Japanese Appetite Do Whales Feed?

hedline.hl1: Which Japanese Appetite Do Whales Feed?

block.p: The Japanese whaling industry exaggerates the importance of whale meat by trying to link the old-style whaling that occurred in a few coastal villages to the modern industrial style. As your June 24 Shimonoseki Journal mentions, many middle-aged Japanese remember eating whale meat, a cheap source of protein, in school lunch programs after World War II.

The Japanese whaling industry exaggerates the importance of whale meat by trying to link the old-style whaling that occurred in a few coastal villages to the modern industrial style. As your June 24 Shimonoseki Journal mentions, many middle-aged Japanese remember eating whale meat, a cheap source of protein, in school lunch programs after World War II.

Today, whale meat has become a delicacy, with a wholesale cost of around $160 a pound. The Japanese whaling industry continues to kill hundreds of minke whales every year under the guise of scientific research, only to sell the meat for high prices.
The same lure of high prices in Japan encouraged the Norwegian whaling industry to attempt the illegal export of 60 tons of whale meat, the equivalent of about 30 minke whales, in April.
Japanese whalers complain that world opinion is imposing its culinary traditions on Japan. They should stop imposing their appetite for profit on the world's fragile ocean ecosystems.
